Lessons.script:
[disableui]
[board]
[print][sp]>>~Computers have become everyday tools because of their versatility and efficiency, thus|In order to enhance operational skills in the use of computers^, knowledge of efficient and effective keyboarding skills and typing ergonomics has become inevitable today.
[print][sp]>>Learning to use the keyboard effectively is an important skill. This software is designed to help you accomplish that. 
[print][sp]>>Here you are going to master a ~very productive|vital|great^ ~technique|skill|strategy^ of typing ~called "touch typing"|(touch typing)|known as touch typing^. 
[print][sp]>>We promise you, ~with this software|here^, you are going to enhance your typing speed and accuracy in a great and funny way.".
[delay]>>3000
[print][sp]>>~"Touch typing" is a ~technique|skill|strategy^ for typing quicker and more accurately with all fingers and one thumb, without ever having to look at the keyboard|Touch typing is a typing ~technique|skill|strategy^ that allows a typist to type without looking at the keyboard. This involves using all fingers and one thumb.^ This ~technique|skill|strategy^ advances the typist's speed and accuracy dramatically.
[showkb]
[hk]>>j<<k<<l<<;<<a<<s<<d<<f<<
[print][sp]>> ~Touch typing|it^ typically involves placing the eight fingers in a horizontal row along the middle of the keyboard~, known as the home row| (the home row)^,  and having them reach for other keys from that row. 
[print][sp]>>Each finger has its own set of keys. The animation below will quickly show you which finger presses which key.
[uh]
[hk]>>a<<q<<z<<1
[delay]>>1000
[hk]>>2<<w<<s<<x
[delay]>>1000
[hk]>>3<<e<<d<<c
[delay]>>1000
[hk]>>f<<r<<v<<g<<t<<b<<4<<5
[delay]>>1000
[hk]>>j<<u<<m<<h<<y<<n<<6<<7
[delay]>>1000
[hk]>>k<<i<<,<<8
[delay]>>1000
[hk]>>l<<o<<.<<9
[delay]>>1000
[hk]>>;<<p<<0<<-<<=<<[<<]<<'<</<<enter<<rshift<<backspace
[delay]>>6000
[print][sp]>> ~As for now|For now^, you don't have to ~keep memory of|memorize^ these, I will help you with that through out the whole course, until it's all ~stuck in your head|natural to you^.
[uh]
[h]>>space
[print][sp]>> You use one of your thumbs to press the space bar, and you have to be consistent with the thumb of your choice.
[uh]
[h]>>j<<k<<l<<;<<a<<s<<d<<f
[print][sp]>> In this ~session|lesson|exercise^ ~we|you^ ~are going to|will^ focus a lot more on the home row. The home row is the middle row of your keyboard, as highlighted below. This is where your fingers must ~be accustomed|rest^ ~and it is the base from which all other keys can be reached|^.
[uh]
[hk]>>j<<f
[print][sp]>>Now place your hands on the keyboard, as shown below, with your right ~pointy|index^ finger on letter 'J', and your left on 'F'. 
[delay]>>6000
[print][sp]>> ~You must have noticed that there is a little bar, or dot on each of these keys ('F' and 'J'). These are there for ~your aid|the aid of a touch typist^, to locate the home row without looking down at the keyboard. These will soon be your best friends, if not yet.|Can you feel small bumps on the F and J keys? They are there to help you (a touch typist) find the home row keys without looking at your ~hands|keyboard^.^
[view]
[delay]>>2000
[sp]>> Now let's get into ~exercises|sessions^.  If you can't remember which finger to use, ~no worries|don't worry| don't be worried^. The hands below shows you exactly how to do it. ~Let's begin!|You may start!|Let's start|You can ~start|begin^ now!|Let's get started|You can start^
[lesson]>>~fff jjj fff jjj fff jjj fff jjj fff jjj ff jj ff jj jk fd jk fd jk fd kj df kj df kk dd kk dd as lk as lk as lk as lk asdf ;lkj fdsa jkl; ss sass kk ll all kal jf jf fj fj a; a; sl sl dk dk fj fj jf jf kd kd ls ls ;a ;a ;a ;a jf fj|fff jjj fff jjj fj fj jf jf dk dk kd kd sl sl ls ls a; a; all dak kad dak kad jad faj jad faj ks ks dl dl dl dl dl dd ll ds lk slk slk dlk fj fj jf jf las kas jas das|fj fj fj fj fj ffjj ffjj ffjj ffjj jjff jjff jjff jjff jjff ffjj ffjj ffjj ffjj jjff jjff jk fd jk fd das kl kl klak lakl lak jf jkl as das jkl jkl fds ;;; ;;; aa;; ;;; aa;; aa;; as; das; sad; jas; kal; s;; ;;^<<Lesson 1.a

[board]
[print][sp]>>The ability to type and use a computer keyboard is essential in this modern day world. As improving reading and writing skills , it’s a great idea to include computer and typing training. 
[print][sp]>>And the great part about this ~course|software|curriculum^ is you are just going to be learning that.!
[print][sp]>>Here, you are going to master a ~very productive|vital|great^ ~technique|skill|strategy^ of typing ~called "touch typing"|(touch typing)|known as touch typing^. 
[delay]>>3000
[print][sp]>>Touch typing is a typing ~technique|skill|strategy^ that allows a typist to type ~ |using memory muscle, hence,^ without  ~using the sense of sight|looking at the keyboard^. This involves using all fingers and one thumb. This ~technique|skill|strategy^ advances the typist's speed and accuracy dramatically.

[print][sp]>>~For you|In order^ to ~catch|learn|get|grasp^ faster key positions, you have to ~learn|teach yourself^ not to ~peek|look^ at ~your|the^ keyboard, when training. If you can't ~recall|remember^ ~where a key is located|the location of a certain key^, look at the ~onscreen keyboard|keyboard on screen^, ~provided|provided by this software^ during lessons.
[print][sp]>>~Quoting|Saying^ out letters ~silently|in your head^ or loud, as you type, can also help you ~grasp|memorize|learn|catch^ key positioning faster.
[delay]>>3000

[board]
[print][sp]>>Each key is pressed by the finger on the home row that is closest. After reaching a key away from the home row, the finger needs to return to its home row key.
[print][sp]>>Make sure you always return your finger to its rest place, on the home row. This will help you to quickly grasp the relation of the keys, to your home keys.
[delay]>>1000

[board]
[print][sp]>>Touch typing comes with a lot of ~pros|advantages|benefits^. Because of computers' versatility and efficiency, people tend to spend hours on a computer each day.
[print][sp]>>Unfortunately, computers requires a lot of repetitive movement, that can cause discomfort and fatigue and even lead to Irrevocable Repetitive Strain Injuries (RSI).
[print][sp]>>However, "Touch Typing" uses all fingers, so load is distributed ~to|across^ all fingers, ~lessening the chances of injury|preventing these dangers^.
[print][sp]>>This also means you will enjoy long typing hours, without strain or stress. You will become even more productive in your tasks.
[delay]>>100
